reviewText: The cardio segment of this workout is fabulous and lots of fun.  Some people complain about Ms. Taylor's complex moves, these are exactly what keep me interested and will keep me doing this for a long time in the future.  The stretching segment makes for a great cooldown and good stretch.  The reason I only gave 4 is because of the strength section.  I just can't find it in me to do 15 min of squats, along with pushups.  I'm not in bad shape but it gets pretty painful after the first 5 min.  So, basically, I skip this section and move right to stretching making for about a 45 min workout. Some days I add a short upper body weight segment from another workout to make it a full hour.  I do recommend this.  Try Totally Hot Cardio is you want a 60 min--5 min Warm up, 50 min of Cardio and 5 min abs.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is ANOTHER great Christi workout.  It's the latest of hers that I have.  I don't know why this has taken so long to be released through amazon when other companies have it already, but nevertheless, this is a terrific dvd.  It's fun, motivating, challenging and high high energy.  There is floor aerobics for a little over a half hour, and then there is toning.  Her cueing is again superb and it's never hard to follow because of this great instruction.  The thing I like about this workout and her others, is her teaching style, because what she does is teaches you in layers.  She begins with a simple easy step, repeats it for a bit and then adds to it often.  Before you know it, you're doing what looked impossible when you first watch it through.  Don't fret if you don't get it right away, because at the end is a helpful segment where each move is broken down easily.  A must workout dvd.  Better than anything else out there.
summary: Once you've seen Christi, there is no other instructor
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this without reading any other customer reviews on other sites. There were more negative than positive. I thought it would be fun to try one of Christi's videos. About one quarter of the way through I gave up on the first segment of it. She moved through the steps way too fast and it was very, very dancey, I was very frustrated. I think it would take quite a long time to get this routine down if you make it through the frustrations. I watched the second workout and it looked only slightly easier to follow. The toning looks like it would be easier to follow, I will try that out, but overall I am disappointed in the DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Christi really took great care in selecting excellent music and creating a choreographed routine that perfectly matches the music! It's incredible, it's not only the rythm and the exercise that match perfectly, even when in the song they are saying something, Christy sings for example "in a square" and the choreography makes you form a square, then she sings "down and out" and you put your arms down and out. I am not exactly sure what they say in the original song - my English is not always catching the lyrics properly - but it definitely sounds like what Christy is saying...It is this little details that reveal Christi's passion and love for what she is doing. In fact I have seen trailers of other Christi's DVD's (cardio and step) and she seems to be obsessed to choose the perfect music for her exercises and to add some flair to traditional exercises (a hip sway or something), this makes exercising with her totally different and FUN, although her routines are tough. The choreographies are somewhat difficult at the beginning but with some practise you will get into them (maybe 1-2 weeks). I also strongly recommendBootcamp Boogie, which has also good music and is a bit easier if you have difficulties with or do not like more elaborate choreographed routines. Petra's DVD includes more "workout"-type exercises in very simple combinations.CARDIO CHALLENGE: Medium to high TONING: Very good CHOREOGRAPHY DIFFICULTY: Beginner to intermediate INSTRUCTIONAL QUALITY: Excellent MUSIC: Excellent FUN FACTOR: Very highCONTENTS:- Two workouts (called Funk Phase I and II) each one consisting in several choreographed routines that do not repeat themselves. The first routine in each of the workouts is a bit slower, so it is practically your warm-up. Christi builds up each routine by adding a new exercise each time. I consider the workouts tough (not like weight lifting), but there are a lot of lunges, squats, repeaters, etc. and the cardio level gets also high.- Strength - tough toning routine. This segment is not my favorite, in fact I almost never use it, since exercises are very repetitive, Christi herself says that we are not going to be "creative" in this segment. I get easily bored with workouts and simply want to stop. If you do not have this problem, this segment is an excellent workout. The good thing about this DVD is that it has something for every taste if you would like to "get ripped", this segment is for you, if you would like to have fun while exercising the Funk Segments are your choice. (PD - two years later: I now love the toning segment, it's very effective).- Stretch - Simply excellent athletic stretches- Movemaster - slow explanation of the individual choreographiesMUSIC:From my workout DVD's (including dance workouts) the music in this one is my absolute favorite, and it is not just the music selection, it is the fact that the volume of the music compared to the instructor's voice is perfect to let you enjoy the music and exercise to it while still hearing the cueing and most of all it is how the music blends into the choreographies. For the Funk Phases it's pop, latin, etc. while for the strength segment there is live drums to mark the beat by Justin (Christi's son).EMPHASIS:A perfect combination of cardio and toning (mainly lower body - legs and glutes - and a bit of abs). It also includes several excellent balance exercises, which I always find very good. All exercises are performed standing, except for the cooldown that requires a mat.WHAT IS BETTER THAN IN OTHER DVD'S:+ Music selection: THE BEST IN WORKOUT OR DANCE DVD'S I OWN, the music really makes this DVD special+ FUN: This DVD is one of my favorites, in fact it is one of the few workout videos I like and enjoy.+ Cardio and toning mix+ Balance exercises and cooldown stretchesI would recommend this DVD as an excellent introduction to working out (this one will motivate you to start exercising and then you can move on to gym-style workouts), as an alternative for your regular workouts (to get a bit of variety or a bit of cardio into your toning routines), or if you are more the walking or dance routine type of person, this is an excellent way of getting a bit of more intense toning and cardio into your life, without being the typical bootcamp or workout DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: Another Keeper!, January 23, 2008By  Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!" (CA) - See all my reviewsI am such a Christi Taylor DVD fan! Her DVD's are always very well cued, fun and produced well.This one features her son on the drums during the movemaster (which is a tutorial I think all exercise DVD's should have) and the music during the routine is upbeat and fun.This DVD does include quite a few dancey steps, but who wants a DVD you can do perfectly the first time you attempt it??? I like the steps and combinations in this one and I think her positive and upbeat attitude reaches out through the screen to the viewer.This DVD also includes a stength and abs workout that the DVD's that I own (Her other DVD's) don't have. If I have time, I can combine my workout and get everthing done in one session, but I usually can't cut out that big of a block of time.Again, this DVD is fun, fast and funky. You may need to practice with the Movemaster to do all the moves correctly, but it is fun and you will sweat!
Title: N/A
